verse: The covenant chest of the Eternal One had been in the land of the Philistines for seven months.
Then the rulers of the Philistines sent for their priests and fortune-tellers.
And that is what the leaders did. They separated two milk cows from their calves. They yoked the cows to the wagon and took the calves home.
They set the covenant chest of the Eternal upon the wagon, and next to it, they placed the box with the gold tumors and gold mice.

The cows went straight along the road toward Beth-shemesh, mooing after their lost calves as they went. They went straight ahead without any hesitation, and the rulers of the Philistines followed as far as the border of Beth-shemesh.
The people of Beth-shemesh were in the valley harvesting their wheat at that time. When they looked up and saw the covenant chest, they ran to greet it with joy.

The wagon came to a halt at a large stone in the field of Joshua of Beth-shemesh. The people split up the cart for firewood and sacrificed the cattle as a burnt offering to the Eternal One on the large stone.

The Levites took the chest of the Eternal and the box next to it down from the wagon. They took the gold images from the box and set them upon the stone altar. Then the people of Beth-shemesh offered sacrifices and made other burnt offerings to the Eternal One.
When the five rulers of the Philistines saw how their offering had been received that day, they returned to Ekron.
The five gold images of swollen tumors presented to the Eternal One by the Philistines as a guilt offering represented Ashdod, Gaza, Ashkelon, Gath, and Ekronâ€”one for each.

Likewise the golden mice represented all the cities of the Philistines governed by their rulers, both the walled cities and the villages surrounding them. The large stone in the field of Joshua of Beth-shemesh where they set the chest of the Eternal remains there as a witness to these events.

The Eternal struck the people of Beth-shemesh because some looked into the covenant chest. God struck down 75 men, and the people were saddened because of the slaughter the Eternal One had brought among their people.

So the people of Beth-shemesh sent messengers to the people of Kiriath-jearim to tell them that the Philistines had returned the chest of the Eternal One to Beth-shemesh and that they should come down and take it with them.
